intro: Helictotrichon pallens, commonly known as the pale bluegrass, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, blue-green foliage and small, pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies, meadows, and disturbed soils. It is often found in association with other native grasses and forbs, contributing to the ecological diversity of these environments. Helictotrichon pallens is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to a variety of climate conditions.
